titleStmt.title: Receipt October 13, 257 BC
titleStmt.author: Pasis, son of Samous, 23 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 390

msContents.summary: Bilingual receipt for wages at 2 and a half drachmas per aroura given to Pasis from Panakestor for cutting wood and burning; the double version in Greek is followed by a Demotic copy

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers with 14 lines in Greek; on the back, across the fibers, 1 line in Demotic written turning the papyrus

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 12 (original no. 22) in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Panakestor, -- manager of estate in Philadelphia, Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 386

div.ab: [Greek:] In the reign of Ptolemy son of Ptolemy Soter, year 29, Mesore 23. Pasis son of Samoys through Hegesias acknowledges receipt from Panakestor, agent of Apollonios, of 5 drachmas for chopping out wood and burning upon 2 arouras. [Demotic:] In year 28 [sic] in the 4th month of the summer [Mesore] on the 23d day. Pa-si son of Dji-emow said to Panakestor: You have given me 2 1/2 kite, the half is 1 1/4, it makes again 2 1/2 kite, for the hacking out (and) burning of wood upon the fields of Apollonios.
